properties.name: Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 700 W Magnolia Ave, Auburn, AL 36832My apartment. I live in Eagles West apartments run by Northcutt Realty. I choose the location because it\'s within walking distance of the Lowder Business Building where all my classes are and is even closer to the Mises Institute. Because of construction, there is actually no entrance on W. Magnolia Ave. I have to enter by car from W. Glenn Ave. At the entrance is a really big pothole I hope they get around to fixing someday.

properties.name: Applebees
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 1627 Opelika Road, Opelika, ALI get takeout from Applebees once a week. When I do, my order is fried shrimp with cocktail sauce, garlic mashed potatos, and a basket of garlic bread.

properties.name: Best Buy
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton2147 Gateway Dr., Opelika, ALI bought most of my electronics from this Best Buy. It\'s ridiculous how much I spent on my plasma screen and accessories.

properties.name: Chik-fil-a
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 326 W Magnolia Ave, Auburn, ALI get Chik-fil-a when I\'m extra lazy. It\'s only 5 minutes from where I live (by car). Usually I order two 12-piece nuggets and a large water. I used to eat here 3-4 times a week, but now I\'m down to 1-2 times per week (including the other Chik-fil-a in the Foy Student Union).

properties.name: Cici's Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 1550 Opelika Rd, Auburn, AL 36830Cici\'s Pizza is located near the Mall. It\'s a 10 minute drive from my apartment. Usually I order it, then get engrossed in some online task for an hour. By the time I drive over there to pick it up they\'re surprised I actually showed up and chide me for being late. They are confused by my 215 phone number. I have Cici\'s several nights a week, though I\'m trying to diversify more. The pizza tastes great! It\'s only for a medium. I have to learn to throw part of it away rather than forcing myself to finish the whole thing.

properties.name: Foy Student Union
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 282 West Thach Avenue, Auburn, ALOn my way walking to Chess Club Mondays I pick up Chik-fil-a from the Student Union cafeteria. It lets me multitask eating and playing. Also Auburn Libertarians have had two speakers give presentations in room 246 of the Foy Student Union. Tom Woods spoke on The Politically Incorrect Guide to American History and Mark Thorton gave a talk on the housing bubble. The marker on this map is wrong. I guess because it\'s in the middle of campus (between Mell St. and Duncan Dr.) the map doesn\'t recognize it exists.

properties.name: Lowder Business Building
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton415 W. Magnolia Ave., Auburn, ALAll my classes are in Auburn University\'s Lowder Business Building. It is catty cornered from the Mises Institute and within walking distance of my apartment. Intermediate Macroeconomics taught by Dr. Jackson meets in room 27. Business and Economics Forcasting taught by Dr. Saba met in room 21. The Auburn Economics Club also meets in Lowder. We\'ve had several organizational meetings in room 26. Dr. Stern gave a presentation on the economic conditions of Ukraine (and the former U.S.S.R. in general), where she grew up.

properties.name: Mell Hall
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton271 Mell Street, Auburn, ALChess Club meets at Mell Hall every Monday. They used to start at 7:00 PM, but I got them to move it back to 5:00 PM. I think Mell Hall holds offices for the math faculty. Haven\'t really explored it because Auburn Chess Club meets right in the entrance lobby. We mostly play bughouse - at my insistence. I bring my two sets and Chronos clocks. Everyone else is pretty bad... they\'re getting frustrated at me winning all the time unfortunately. I try to give them time odds or simul or partner a patzer to make it fair. Hopefully once my copy of the bughouse book arrives I can lend it out, improving my competition. The last person leaves at around 11:00 PM. I\'d rather play till sunset.

properties.name: Mises Institute
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton518 W. Magnolia Ave., Auburn, AL 36832The Mises Institute is a libertarian / Austrian economics think tank a block away from my apartment and cattycornered from the Lowder Business Building. When I first came to Auburn, Dick Clark gave me a tour of the Mises Institute. It was new years eve and I was up in the attic looking at an archive of Rothbard\'s personal correspondence and admiring the view from the balcony when 2007 began. Unfortunately the Mises Institute doesn\'t have conferences as often as I would like. I\'ll be missing the Austrian Scholars conference in March to attend a LNC meeting and the State Chairs Conference in Orlando. Hopefully I\'ll be able to attend Mises University this summer and/or get a student research fellowship - if I\'m still in the Auburn area by then.

properties.name: Post Office
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton300 Opelika Rd, Auburn, ALThis is the Auburn post office. I stumbled upon it when I was driving in circles to orient myself to the town. Yesterday I mailed a few letters from there to apply for the California Bar Exam. I anxiously await the day when post offices become completely obsolete... businesses and government really need to learn how to use the Internet.

properties.name: Quizno's Sub (close)
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 125 S College St, Auburn, ALThis Quizno\'s Sub is very close to where I live. But I never go there because parking is metered and there\'s never a free space.

properties.name: Quizno's Sub (far)
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 2199 Tiger Town Pkwy, Opelika, ALThis Quizno\'s Sub is much farther away. It\'s a 15 minute drive (instead of a 5 minute drive for the close one). Still, I prefer this Quizno\'s because it\'s actually possible to park. I get a sub to go here 1-2 times a week. Invariably I order an Italian sub, hold the cheese and olives, extra sauce.

properties.name: Ruby Tuesday's
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 114 Spirit Dr, Auburn, ALOnce a week I get take out from Ruby Tuesday\'s. I order a rack of ribs and fries.

properties.name: Wal-Mart
properties.description: Posted by Chuckmoulton 1717 S College St, Auburn, ALI do as much of my shopping as possible at Wal-Mart. It\'s open 24/7 - unlike the crappy Wal-Marts around where I lived in Pennsylvania! When I first arrived in Auburn, I got all my furniture from Wal-Mart. It was dirt cheap! Nowadays I go there for groceries... usually in the middle of the night when it\'s practically deserted. I\'m saving money and supporting my stock at the same time.
